content.description: Climb the sort of techy face.
content.location: The route up the middle of the main face on the 1st outcropping.  Just right of the 1st project listed in Yoder's guide.

content.description: Fun route with primarily good jugs to pull on. Pleasantly longer than its immediate neighbors to the left.
content.protection: 8-10 (ish) bolts. Rings at anchor - rap unless you want to twist your rope
content.location:
First route right of

Hexagonal Crack

, following the slight arete. First of the three bolt lines that make up the right side of the formation. I was told the middle line is 5.10 but did not climb it. Enjoy raining ticks down on your belayer as you climb through the tree branches that almost touch the rock in a few places.

content.description: Somewhat contrived short route up the left arete of the right Hexagonal wall. Pick the easiest way up the arete choosing between slabby steps on the left side or face climbing along the bolt line.
content.location: Left most route on the right Hexagonal wall. Just left of the obvious hexagonal crack.

content.description:
Obvious crack on the left side of the right formation at Hexagonal Satellites. Short route with some quality jams and finger locks. Better quality than it's moss covered neighbor,

Hexavalent

in my opinion.
content.protection: A few pieces from fingers to #1. Plenty of options to chose from for placements throughout the route. Anchors are bolts with rings, so rappel unless you want to spin your rope.
content.location:
Obvious crack on the left side of the right formation at Hexagonal Satellites. Shares anchors with

Hexavalent

.

content.description: Start up the face clipping a few bolts before moving around the arete to the right. Crux is some thin moves with small feet right off the ground and then eases up as you get higher.
content.location: Farthest right route on the right Hexagonal wall. Starts up the hill behind the large pine tree.

content.description: Ascend the main face past a few horizontal cracks up to the anchor at the highest point on the all. Crux comes around the second bolt and then eases up as you get higher and the angle of the wall lessens.
content.location: Leftmost route on the main face of the left Hexagonal wall.

content.description: Short route starting right on the approach trail. Ascends the left side of the wall. This route is fairly mossy and dirty as it is mostly less than vertical and the crag does not see much traffic.
content.protection: Bolts and bolted anchor with chains
content.location: Farthest left route on the left hex wall. The first route you encounter when approaching the wall from the West.
